impenitence.description: Impenitence is sinful because refusing to repent is a prideful rejection of God's mercy.

impenitence.description: Impenitence is sinful because refusing to repent is a prideful rejection of God's mercy.

extracted_data_phrases: in anger , frustration , or other emotional states
blasphemy.question: Did I swear to God in anger, frustration, or other emotional states?
blasphemy.description: This sin violates the Second Commandment by treating God's holy name with disrespect rather than reverence.

blasphemy.question: Have you sworn to God?
blasphemy.description: This sin violates the Second Commandment by treating God's holy name with disrespect rather than reverence.

blasphemy.question: Did you knowingly receive Holy Communion while harboring unrepented sin in your heart?
blasphemy.description: This mortal sin is a form of sacrilege and profanes the real presence of Christ and shows grave disrespect for the sacrament by receiving unworthily.

blasphemy.question: Did I receive Holy Communion while my heart was not in sync with God's will?
blasphemy.description: This mortal sin is a form of sacrilege and profanes the real presence of Christ and shows grave disrespect for the sacrament by receiving unworthily.

ambition.question: Did my pursuit of authority and influence lead me to seek dominance over those around me, rather than serving them in humility?
ambition.description: inordinate ambition and the obsession with power corrupts the soul by placing our desire to dominate and control above God's authority, turning us away from humble service and toward prideful self-exaltation.

greed.question: Did I let my desire for comfort, security, and stability in old age make accumulation of money and possessions a driving force in my life?
greed.description: This sin makes money an idol that replaces trust in God's providence, turning what should be a tool for good into an object of worship.

greed.question: Did I make accumulating material possessions and wealth a driving force in my life, potentially leading me to prioritize them over my faith and relationships?
greed.description: This sin makes money an idol that replaces trust in God's providence, turning what should be a tool for good into an object of worship.

extracted_data_phrases: through my words , actions , or behaviors that have caused them to feel belittled , excluded , or undervalued
oppression.question: Did I mistreat, harass, or discriminate against others through my words, actions, or behaviors that have caused them to feel belittled, excluded, or undervalued?
oppression.description: It's a sin to execute an unjust and cruel exercise of power or authority over others instead of respecting the God-given dignity of every human person.

extracted_data_phrases: by exercising power or authority over them in an unjust and cruel manner
in an unjust and cruel manner
oppression.question: Have I mistreated, harassed, or discriminated against others by exercising power or authority over them in an unjust and cruel manner?
oppression.description: It's a sin to execute an unjust and cruel exercise of power or authority over others instead of respecting the God-given dignity of every human person.

envy.question: Have I felt jealousy towards others' blessings and secretly wished they would lose them?
envy.description: Envy leads us to have discontent for another's possessions so we won't feel the pain of comparison or perceived lack in our own lives.

envy.question: Have I secretly wished that others would lose their blessings, feeling envious or discontent for what they possess?
envy.description: Envy leads us to have discontent for another's possessions so we won't feel the pain of comparison or perceived lack in our own lives.

incontinence.question: Did I lack self-control and speak to others with words that were hurtful, crude, or unbecoming?
incontinence.description: This sin of incontinence shows a lack of self-restraint and violates the dignity of others.

gluttony.question: Did you overindulge in eating or drinking beyond what's reasonable, leading to an excessive attachment to worldly pleasures?
gluttony.description: This sin of gluttony demonstrates an inordinate attachment to worldly pleasures and rejects the call to temperance.

gossip.question: Have I taken pleasure in discussing others' faults or private affairs through conversations, phone calls, or other forms of communication, even if what I shared was true?
gossip.description: Gossip violates human dignity and charity by harming others' reputations for our own entertainment or pride.

gossip.question: Have I taken pleasure in discussing private family matters, even if what I shared was true?
gossip.description: Gossip violates human dignity and charity by harming others' reputations for our own entertainment or pride.

impiety.question: Have I used my talents, skills, and resources to serve others on a Sunday when it otherwise could be avoided?
impiety.description: It's irreverent to work on a Sunday as it's a holy day of rest, worship, and a day of protest against the servitude of work and the worship of money (CCC).
